Top-3 Scripts:
au_705398: export DISPLAY=:0.0

if [ -n "$SSH_CLIENT" ] || [ -n "$SSH_CONNECTION" ]; then
    export DISPLAY=:0.0
fi

ul_27484: #!/bin/sh

export DISPLAY=":0"
export XAUTHORITY="$1"
export XAUTHLOCALHOSTNAME="localhost"

gsettings set org.gnome.settings-daemon.plugins.power lid-close-ac-action "blank"

#!/bin/sh

export DISPLAY=":0"
export XAUTHORITY="$1"
export XAUTHLOCALHOSTNAME="localhost"

gsettings set $2 $3 $4

au_16621: sudo update-alternatives --config x-www-browser

karthick@Ubuntu-desktop:~$ sudo update-alternatives --config x-www-browser 
There are 3 choices for the alternative x-www-browser (providing /usr/bin/x-www-browser).

  Selection    Path                    Priority   Status
------------------------------------------------------------
  0            /usr/bin/google-chrome   200       auto mode
* 1            /usr/bin/firefox         40        manual mode
  2            /usr/bin/google-chrome   200       manual mode
  3            /usr/bin/opera           90        manual mode

sudo update-alternatives --config www-browser

Explanations about Options.--config:
Show available alternatives for a link group and allow the user to interactively
 select which one to use. The link group is updated.

Answers.MP Summary: show or set the system's host name
create a new user or update default new user information
Answers.Most Similar TLDR Task: Create new user with a default home directory
Top-3 Similar Questions: ul_219922: Set up a user for a program

Explanations about Options.-M:
Do no create the user's home directory, even if the system wide setting from
 /etc/login.defs (CREATE_HOME) is set to yes.
Explanations about Options.-d:
The new user will be created using HOME_DIR as the value for the user's login
 directory. The default is to append the LOGIN name to BASE_DIR and use that as the
 login directory name. The directory HOME_DIR does not have to exist but will not be
 created if it is missing.
Explanations about Options.-U: Create a group with the same name as the user, and add the user to this group.
Explanations about Options.-s: The name of a new user's login shell.
